name: Georgian Terrace Hotel

reviews.title: Absolutely no complaints
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. Got upgraded to a one bedroom suite without even asking. Beautiful kitchen, bath and ample room throughout. It even had a full size washer and dryer. Our room was spotless and I noticed this throughout the hotel. The hotel is very well maintained. We loved the roof top pool and terrace. The location is fabulous. We did not eat at the restaurant, but enjoyed sitting on the front terrace with a cocktail watching the street below. Took a tour of the Fox Theatre across the street, which was very interesting. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

reviews.title: Reservations Not Honored
reviews.text: We booked reservations for several people coming to town on business. Two rooms the first night and four the following two nights. When my first two guests arrived they were told that they could only have one room. We had guaranteed confirmation numbers for TWO rooms. They had no choice but to leave and stay somewhere else, which at 8:00 p.m. was no easy task. THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR BUSINESS TRAVEL - PERIOD! The manager on duty refused to give us his supervisor's name or the name of the owner of the hotel.

reviews.title: Restaurant needs new manager
reviews.text: I see a pattern in the reviews that is comparable to our experience. (Those that do not order food or go to the hotel restaurant give high scores). We were meeting friends to see West Side Story at the Fox. The 2 bedroom suite was ideal except it had only one bathroom. While our room was not the greatest (rain came in around the window frame and soaked window treatments and carpet to the bed-mold and mildew) and the kitchen was very outdated with 0 supplies, I really have no complaints. We were all smiles with the great service we received from the incredible doormen and the front desk. The hotel is thrilling if you are a Gone With the Wind nut or just love historic hotels (our 1st choice if possible, so we are used to not -so- perfect). Our favorite doorman delivered ice rapidly with great fun and jokes. Since it was Sunday and we couldn't find a restaurant nearby that was open and since we didn't want to be late for the show, I suggested the hotel restaurant. I have never been so embarassed in my life. It was very expensive (O.K., Atlanta-meal with friends), but it was absolutely terrible. We ordered 4 different meals, tasted everyone's, and each was worse than the last. The only thing good about it is that it provides ongoing laughs. Even the rolls were bad and Creme Brulee with peaches was very bad vanilla pudding with a piece of peach sugar-candy on top. After our $40.00 dinners we had to buy popcorn at the Fox to fill up. When the show was over, we went to the hotel bar, hoping for a snack. I ordered a White Russian and when I asked for more Kaluha because I only tasted milk water, I was told they had none. What did they give me? At any rate , 3 of us had one drink and 1 had 3 drinks. Then things stopped being funny. When my friend asked why we were charged for 10 drinks when we only had 6 (4 people knew we had 6) he was asked rudely "What is your problem??". He didn't want to make an issue since they were visiting with us, but if I've heard it I would have requested they call the police before I paid. That was another $80.00 down the drain. The bartender had friends visiting that I think we treated. Hotel-4+; Restaurant-0

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I live only 30 minutes from Atlanta and thought it would be nice to stay downtown after a concert at the Fox. The hotel is convenient to the Fox, being right accross the street. The room was okay but the service is horrible. After our concert it was late and nothing was open to eat so we decide to go back to the room for room service. You can order room service till midnight, we ordered food at 11. Room service wants you to leave a message with your order so we did. 11:30 rolls around so I call again to make sure they got our order, leave another message but also call the front desk. He says they should have our order shortly. We are starving at this point but wait. To make a long story short we ended up going to bed hungry, only to be woken up by room service telling us our food was on the way. They delivered our food at 1:20 am and acted like nothing happed. No explanation was given and they did nothing to remedy the situation. The Georgian Terrace is convenient but the service is horrible.
reviews.title: Horrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband planned a fabulous anniversary weekend for me, including a show at the Fox Theatre, Dinner at Einstein's, and an amazing stay at the Georgian Terrace Hotel in Atlanta. We were greeted with the warmth and hospitality you'd expect from a Georgia Hotel. Our room was incredible, especially for the price. We had a one-bedroom suite with a washer and dryer and full kitchen (yes, full....oven, stove, big fridge, microwave, etc.). We had a large sitting room and dining area filled with bright light from the wall of windows. Our bedroom had such "Old Southern Charm," it was beautiful. The room was actually round (because it was in one of the round towers of the hotel), and had incredible views of the Fox Theatre, downtown Atlanta, and Stone Mountain. We enjoyed martinis in the hotel bar, and spent a while touring the whole hotel. We saw the Grand Ballroom which hosted the Premier Party for Gone With the Wind, and it was certainly Grand. The hotel was filled with old tile (miticulously laid), enormous crystal chandeliers, fabulous wood work, and towering southern columns. Our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer. It is the best hotel in the city for a romantic weekend.
reviews.title: Southern Hospitality and Charm is key at the Georgian Terrace in Atlanta

reviews.title: Hotel Staff Steals!!!!
Terrible Experience; Would never stay here again!
reviews.text: I was attracted to the Georgian Terrace because I prefer to stay in historic hotels in urban areas. However, I was soon disappointed. Upon my arrival, I was greeted at the front of the hotel by a chaotic scene featuring two African immigrants (totally untrained hotel employees) who got into an argument about where I was to park my vehicle to check in. Not a exactly good greeting or start. Once inside, I had to wait for 15 minutes to reach the front desk to check in.

likes.liked: — Good location and the historic features of the hotel

reviews.text: Upon reaching the front desk, I learned that the non-smoking suite I had paid for on expedia was actually not available and I had to have a smoking suite or a non-smoking king. I chose the non-smoking king, although it had been cheaper on expedia and the front desk claimed they could not adjust downward the rate. On top of this, I was given a little attitude by the front desk staffer and made to wait another 15 minutes while they cleaned my room.
reviews.title: The Good, the Bad, the Ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because I was now late to a meeting, I grabbed my loaded dolly and proceeded to the elevator only to be "greeted"by a surly bellboy who demanded that I give him the cart in what was clearly an attempt to shake me down for a tip for what was very poor service. I finally relented and left for my room.
reviews.title: Great Location, Big Rooms, Great Price
Enjoyed the Georgian Terrace
reviews.text: Upon entering the room, it became clear that the hotel rooms had not been updated at all since the 1980s when this building was used for apartments. My king room was actually a former studio apartment complete with a very dated kitchen and a washer/dryer! The sheets were stained, the walls and carpet were worn and the bathroom was reminiscent of a holiday inn. I decided to shake this off and got dressed and left.

Later than evening, after dinner, my wife and I had purchased a bottle of wine and we sat on the terrace facing Peachtree after the hotel bar had closed and leisurely drank the wine. Soon after, we were inundated with bums who frequent the midtown area and scurry about like cockroaches. They even began threatening us when we refused to give them money. Of course, there were no hotel staff or security of any kind around the terrace at this hour at least. We eventually went inside and vowed never to stay here again.
reviews.title: Not What We Expected

reviews.text: We spent two nights at this lovely hotel and were thrilled with the location, the price, and the service.
reviews.title: We'll Be Back

reviews.text: Upon arrival, the very kind woman at the reception upgraded us from a standard room to a one bedroom suite. It was spacious, clean, and felt like being back home.
reviews.title: Hotel is Wearing Down

reviews.text: We were within steps of great restaurants and we really enjoyed our evening at the Fox Theater, which is just across the street.
reviews.title: A Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: In all, we would recommend this hotel without hesitation. It is beautiful and the service is outstanding. Also, don't miss the rooftop pool. The views are fantastic.
reviews.title: This hotel has a great location and very nice staff.

likes.disliked: — Homeless people roam up and down Peachtree. Especially late at night.

reviews.text: Everything that could work slowly, poorly, or not all, seemed to: the front desk check-in/checkout, elevators, business center internet, room tv remote control. I stayed in a "luxury suite" and it had a corporate crash pad feel to it. The immediate neighborhood, even on Peachtree, is borderline dangerous and you get hassled by street men regularly if you walk out the front door. On the plus side, the bed was great, the rooftop lap pool nice, and the lobby area was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Old Hollywood Meetings Southern Charm

description: A Midtown icon, the Georgian Terrace Hotel is located in the heart of Atlanta’s business and cultural district, across from the Fox Theatre. The hotel delivers a brand of service rarely found, even in the South. We’re set to please with everything from big modern suites to versatile event and meeting spaces. Our business facilities are state of the art. We offer a world-class conference center, an impressive boardroom, classic ballrooms and secure, onsite parking. Just off our lobby, Livingston Restaurant + Bar serves award-winning American cuisine. Reserve one of our 326 rooms or suites today.
